result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Daniel Brown

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:35 PM Defendant Jacob Daniel Brown appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Jacob Daniel Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court, jury trial to be set.

Activity: Preliminary hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob Daniel Brown appeared by audio.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Jacob Daniel Brown. Parties stipulate to identification of defendant appearing by audio only. Officer Bruce Danielson of Janesville Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney. Matter continued for arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

09:17 AM  Prosecuting attorney Richard Jay Sullivan appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob Daniel Brown appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Jacob Daniel Brown. Preliminary hearing requested.  Time limits waived. Zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Activity: adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob Daniel Brown not in court.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by letter. Prliminary Hearing set July 19, 2022 at 9:00 am.
Letter from attorney Zaleski to courts
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:15 PM Defendant Jacob Daniel Brown in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of paraphernalia. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 1PM.
Not to consume or possess a controlled substance without a valid prescription and in prescribed amounts only. No possession of paraphernalia.
